content.taskInstructions:
If you identify a Blob storage SAS token URL (see below) in the application, checke the "se" parameter for the expiration on the SAS token.

In the example below, we can see that the token expires in 2040. Use the attached finding to call out the issue.

https://netspiexample.blob.core.windows.net/?sv=2020-08-04&ss=bfqt&srt=sco&sp=rwdlacupitfx&se=2040-11-03T04:40:45Z&st=2020-11-02T20:40:45Z&spr=https,http&sig=tfTo6fdiC2e79wqf5gXOAY06Vb%2BAQXy2nBukQRH48kQ%3D

masterFinding.remediationInstructions: Modify the token creation process to limit the token expiry time to a shorter window.
masterFinding.name: Azure SAS - Excessive Token Lifetime
masterFinding.businessImpact: By gaining access to a URL that contains the SAS token, an attacker may have an extended window for accessing the files and folders scoped to the SAS token. This could lead to unauthorized access to files in the storage account.
masterFinding.description: The affected Azure Storage Account issues Shared Access Signature (SAS) tokens with excessively long expiration dates.
